entry.content:
You people have nothing to worry about, you'll get jobs easily. The problem is for people like us

Ankur quipped while we are discussing the prospects of getting job after college.

We are discussing the prospects of getting job after college. The uncertainty caused by past IT recessions trigger this. Weather is pleasant. We are sitting outside a Nirulas’ under picnic umbrellas. This is part of a laid back market complex which does not do much business. It is walking distance from college, we love to take a long walk from college to here.

Ashish has been kicked out from the group, and some friends choose to stay with him. I wanted to, but I choose to stay where Anusha seems to be comfortable. This has reduced the number from around 15 to 5. We are bunking some class, sitting outside a food joint. I am holding Anusha's hand, she might have felt my hand twitch.

Being a perennial back bencher and flunking in numerous examinations (total 5 papers till now), I do not know how to respond to this unexpected attack. Being a SC/ST student, it has become apparent to me that I cannot be just lazy, average or not interested, I am just an incompetent loser who does not deserve to sit between these enlightened beings. They seem to be doing me a favor by caring to listen to me.

After a long silence, considering the path of least resistance, i decided to change the topic.

The job market is difficult after the recession. All of us have some hard time ahead of us

But the Jack Maa look alike had to make make his point.

Why do you why people like you would look into the private job market? There's so many of amazing opportunities available in the government sector. And believe me, you will earn far more than the private sector

Oh, somebody say something…...silence!!

It's not for everyone to see things your way.

I think that ended the discussion.

Oh, the crucial part of this open discrimination practiced by teachers, students and even chaprasis of this great institute – Bharati Vidyapeeth, Delhi and the even greater dumb-ass university it represents – Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University, was allocating the roll numbers – I think first 6 roll numbers represent the reserved community – SC/STs or chuda/chamar as thought of by the these enlightened and entitled middle class chutias.

I looked at Anusha as she is looking into my eyes. She is asking me to ignore this, but I cant seem to decide. We decide to go back to college. She has been one of those rare humans who has offered me parity – of thought, ability….respect of being treated like another human being.

We were happy gang of 15 middle class misfits, who who liked each other some of them had romantic inclinations. Some things have changed. Now we are 5/7 people (2 of them cant seem to decide).

Anusha is like a friend I never deserved or worked for. Of all the people in my life, I think she is the only one who feels what I am going through. I have never shared details of the legal and moral issues I am facing at home, but she only knows about Gunjan, and how I am still deeply in love with a with her.

I feel i am selfishly using her. I have no prospects, a loser to the core, still she prefers me. Even I don't prefer myself these days. She still does.

Gunjan....I don't know if she will be back or she has gone for good. I cant stop thinking about her. Maybe she is dating a stud she deserves...maybe she is being tricked by one of the thousand bastards who seem to be following her day and night. Anyways, I don't seem to deserve her. She has a good idea or some suspicion of me being an undeserving chamar who tricked her into accepting my proposal.....good that nothing happened....this guilt of tricking her would have killed me.

Here is Anusha, the best of girls I would ever meet....holding my hand despite knowing my reality. I can feel love when she holds my hand.

And I don't know how it happened. I don't even remember the first time I held her hand, it seemed to have happened spontaneously.

As far as i can remember, she was talking me about a guy she seemed to have been dating, and it did not end well...i understood....and maybe that is how we became friends.

Much of the things between us seemed to be unsaid. She will wait for me, I would wait for her....find any simple excuse to be with her.....go on long walks....bunk classes to be with her. She did not seem to mind sitting on my old scooter.

She somehow understood....and I could feel her....her hands told me all i needed to know....some weird telepathy shit....or i am delusional.

I know what hurts her, I know when I hurt her, and how could I make it alright. She never hurt me.....and when she did....it was brutal

Coming back to the present moment,This awkward argument means Jack Maa is targeting me now. After kicking Ashish and his loyalists out, everyone in this leftover group of 7 is a bloody beta, all ugly, short or severely limited in intellect....basically an un-date-able set of severely undeserving poor specimen of the male form. No one Anusha or any conscious female or any functional girl would ever consider.

Or am I about to be proved wrong???

entry.content:
26 Sept 2003

I think i passed engineering. Not happy but relieved.

I am oscillating between a deep sense of regret of not doing the things I wanted to do in engineering and the relief that I survived despite all odds.

As part of the first batch of engineering from this college, there are not many prospects to start with. Though I am trying for jobs, my heart knows that i will not get any - grades and the way I looked - deformed bald and itchy.

I am trying to prepare for GATE, to finally do the nerdy stuff which i am very capable of doing. 4 years of engineering taught me a valuable lesson - people are highly ordinary - not capable of creating anything new, just masters of mugging and following the orders.

The legal storm caused by my sisters adventures finally seems to be over, my father seems to have it handled. I never disclosed it to anyone, but I am prepared to do anything if the situation goes worse. Every night I evaluate the strategy, the tools and the things I need to be careful about. This decision is a combined result of my current state, my duties as a brother and my complete belief that life would not be any different from what I have experienced it till now. Life in prison sounded way real and acceptable than spending years with the scared yet competitive sheep of engineering college graduates.

My mom and father love each other. I cant make sense of it. My father is a principled, hard working individual, though my mother is really nothing but manipulative, power hungry, ugly excuse of a female. It is not like only I hated her, all of us did, except my father.

At least once a month, my mother and father would take off to a date of sorts - they would leave in morning and come back late at night. This has been one of the happiest days of the month for me and my sisters for years.

Off late, I have distanced myself from my second sister. I like being alone and destructive, a man who has no one and nothing to loose. The people around me are too busy to cater to their plans to take over the world, who would care about a discolored, bottom of the class chamar boy? Hey, my answer is the same as you, hence the going out in brotherly glory plan.

I am happy at the prospect of never going back to the college again, forced to communicate with those judgmental pricks of classmates, teachers who would congratulate me and suggest that i would get a fat sarkari job now. Somehow Infy, TCS, Polaris etc are never discussed with me.

Mom and Dad left for their monthly date, sister is out doing whatever she does. I am up, go to the computer room and dial up the Internet. Checking mail, yeah....no prospects, the self destruct plan stands. Phone rings.

I hate phone....she never calls, and she wont. She knows now, at-least suspects it...me being a chamaar. How can the shiniest, most popular girl date a chamar? Anyways, I will explain the situation later.

I answer, the digits seem similar - the call is from our family cell phone. I pick up, though i do not recognize the voice. The voice is of my uncle, he is trying to tell me something important in a very non important way. The car has broken down, and i need to come to get it fixed. I should get a friend to drive my bike back so I could drive the car after getting it repaired. The location is near a hospital. I say yes, and did not argue how illogical the plan sounded. In the background i could hear a lot of commotion. Anyways, i needed to patch up my appearance and drive a bike with no rear brakes for 100 kms. When you are on a death wish, these choices are really not a choice.

I call up a friend, a fellow SC/ST boy who flunked and now is a junior. Caste seems to be the only quality which defines my life right now. I am afraid of the general friends - ex girl friend might have blabbered..the news might have spread....and i have lost my looks. Most of people avoid me in college, the friends i thought i had left me because a girl who seems to have loved me, told everyone that i molested her. I never did. I literally and figuratively had lost my face and most friends with it.

SC friend shows up. He is riding pillion and i am driving my Bajaj caliber chroma. My friend is asking a lot of questions, i don't have any answers.

I drive, having some non-sense chatter with friend. My mind is racing though. Maybe my grandmother is sick or died and maybe my dad is too broken up to drive. This seemed to be the most logical interpretations of the facts i could recall.

After an hours drive, we arrive at a hospital. As i enter, I could see 100s of faces I had forgotten. They seemed to be all watching me closely. I am not sure if its due to my current appearance or due to the incident.

Something is amiss. The damn car seems fine. People are crying, I am trying to find someone talk-able. Someone directs me to a sub group. Mother is crying, trying to be sad than she is.

Father is dead.

How, why and what the fuck? Did her stupidity killed him or was it an assault? I am enraged, hoping it was an assault....and i get to kill someone for it...finally justify my existence. It was a heart attack.

I don't understand...are they sure? This is a good private hospital...they must be sure. I could have reacted way more naturally had I was not surrounded by literally 100s of people. Indians love drama, and i was customary bound to provide it today.

Something has hardened me enough to disobey conventions, and to realize what it means.....I am no longer the kid brother, or someone who can ask for help. With my stupid mom and uncontrollable sister.....what the literal fuck?? I need help to come to terms of what is happening to me and now this added responsibility too?

Nothing is fair. As my brain is processing the implications, I am interrupted - there are choices to be made. Where to do the kriyas? I don't know. I am thinking here. I have my uncles, and I do not know what is to be done. My mother interferes. She turns off her crying for a moment and tells me to tell them Rohini, at our new home. I want to protest, but then a dollop of emotional superiority infused cold logic shrewd logic is disclosed....we need to keep up the reputation. I just want to be alone, as soon as possible. I say yes. Handing over the keys of the bike to the friend i tell him to be careful, the rear brakes are not working, the front ones do, but they are more effective than one anticipates.

Life would never be the same again.

Recently an ignorant asshole of general garbage origin shared an article which kind of forced me to increase the priority of this rather dead blog.

How India's ancient caste system is ruining lives in Silicon Valley

WashingtonPost : A new lawsuit shines a light on caste discrimination in the U.S. and around the world

The Cisco Case Could Expose Rampant Prejudice Against Dalits in Silicon Valley

For the uninitiated, Chamar is one of the sub castes, which also comes under rather lager or politically correct term Dalit.

Though centuries have passed, the discrimination remains prevalent as ever.

Most people generally assume that people belonging to this category of caste have an easy, express path to professional success and prosperity, A notion which i aim to challenge and provide a real life view.

I can only cover the aspects which i have faced in the most objective manner, to provide an unbiased perspective.

entry.content:
I loved you. Something in me still loves and misses you.

My long due closure.

Anusha, of all the females i have known in my life, you were the most kind, affectionate, intelligent and million other good things.

You were flawless.

I really wanted to be good for you....for the fact that i could not imagine not having your voice in my life.

As you had given hundreds of hours of me whining about my ex girlfriend Gunjan, I wanted to be sure.

For me, you were pure....an angel....maybe a god.

I really wanted to be sure, when i commit to you I commit for good, not as a insecure rebound from Gunjan.......you were the nicest.

And that time never arrived, and i was sure that it may never. I have not ever really gotten over Gunjan...and i really knew that you have bigger things in store for you....to me it seemed like you chose to score low....your potential was infinite....and I am a chamar boy ....getting Rs 20 a week, who just wanted to die.

And it got worse....skin gave away....and so did my belief of me being destined for self destruction.

I did misbehave with you and probably cheated you emotionally.....but you have to understand....you were the only good in my life back then.

I never really blamed for what happened next...i knew i deserved it....but i would have heard it from you.

It may be possible yet improbable that you might carry some guilt of what happened. Hope this helps....i deserved it and i am sorry.

I still miss you....for you are the only person who may still understand me.

For me, you are still the only person who is truly broken me.....it feels like you still have a part of me, and i still have yours. I still feel you...i still understand your emotions your hands your breath and those thousand different emotions your beautiful eyes conveyed.

I still imagine me exhaling on you soft skin and feeling your scent.

entry.content:
Who

I am a Chamar boy, born in a somewhat normal middle class (not Chamar middle class, normal middle class) family.

I was born in 1981 in a semi-urban village in Delhi.

My father had a Bajaj Super in 1990, and we got a landline telephone in 1997.

I know it's hard to imagine a village in Delhi now, but in 1990 till the time we stayed there, it had a water well, we had cows and cow dung was the primary fuel though my father got us LPG ever since i can remember.

So now here we are. Year is 2020, the most chaotic year for my generation, but somehow I am better placed than I ever was.

I have a spacious (in most senses) house, 2 cars, 2 dogs, a beautiful and intelligent son and mostly loving wife.

And I work at Facebook.

That is the big reveal. 2 Cr.

That declaration is not an achievement, I just want my readers to know what they are dealing with here.

This Facebook and the money thing seems important to society.

Apparently it kind of justifies my existence. People are nicer.

Hypocrisy of society becomes very apparent when you are even minutely successful.

Ever since I have realized what Chamar is, and how apparently we have special powers given by the constitution, a subject of envy and inflammatory debates on social media and hushed discussion in social circles.

Why

As I am getting older, I do tend to think about the past, mostly to learn from it. I remember those days, when my self worth was negative million.

I was targeted, gaslit at college, did not take it well, slipped in a depression, developed Psoriasis, spent years in a sham ayurvedic ashram with skin swollen like a balloon filled with pus covered in cow dung.

Abandonment by the girl I loved, the girl who loved me, friends, my own family. A failed suicide attempt, living through vengeance, death of father, a sister which destroyed the family, destroyed my existence.

All because I am a Chamar.

It was not all bad, It somehow made me realize the strengths which I thought I never had, and did generally well. Something kept me pushing, and I kept breathing.

I want to share my journey with you. Anyone who feels like I did in my Chamar years can get some semblance of hope or direction and hopefully he/she does not commit the grave mistakes I did, or felt like how I felt.

To Readers

I hope you get a balanced view of a Chamar life and hopefully next time you feel like feeling taller, maybe you will be empathetic to the SC/ST humanoid in your class, office or school.

If you feel like saying stuff, you have the full freedom to give me a piece of your mind, absolutely brutally.

I have will update the blog in a way that anonymous are welcome and give me their best shot. It's sort of a fuel to me now.

To my fellow Chamaar/SC/ST Readers

I hope you learn.

I hope you feel hopeful.

I hope you can believe in yourself, rather than what society is telling you silently.

If my journey can benefit any one of you, my efforts would make sense to me.

How

I will try to narrate it in a novel kind of style.

You already know where I am.

Logically my story starts in class 11, when I started realizing the implications of being a chamar, what it meant for career, for making friends, girls and neighborhood.

I have changed certain key details, to preserve the identity of the people involved.

I will narrate the journey, leaving the judgment to readers.

entry.title: College Year 1 ends
entry.summary:
Loser….in every sense of the word.

Gunjan has left, I dont exactly know why….but I do have few ideas. I do not have the courage to face her. If she knows that am a chamar boy, then she has decided this, then things might be better left unsaid …
entry.content:
Loser….in every sense of the word.

Gunjan has left, I dont exactly know why….but I do have few ideas. I do not have the courage to face her. If she knows that am a chamar boy, then she has decided this, then things might be better left unsaid….this is something I am born with, cant really change that….i have dreaded this moment for last 3 years …. feel relived in a weird way.

I did decently in the first semester, the second semester was a different story all together. A lot of things have changed. I failed an exam, and barely passed this semester – 59% . This effectively means I am bottom of the class, solidifying my chamar level intellect and capabilities. I am not really concerned, there are bigger problems.

Home is a hellhole right now. I am dealing with some potentially legal and ethical issues ...due to some questionable acts done by my younger sister. As a brother, I am bound to act….these acts may be illegal, and might really require physical confrontation…..decisive confrontations….my sister’s honor is involved. The dilemma is how to make sure she remains protected even if I am not there anymore….cant involve parents, they are already drinking to their full capacity…. They wont be able to take it. I am trying, but nothing seems to be do-able without really killing anyone in a clean strike. Legal is not an option, my sister would come out looking bad. Cant really discuss with friends….or ask for help….cant share the details. I am on my own for now.

Gunjan leaving me, and the manner in which she did…..leaves me with a lot of questions….my existence, my worth and the fact that this chamar birth is the underlying layer of my identity ….. which cannot be changed. I cannot ignore this feeling of hollowness, and the lingering doubt that no matter how much I try or contribute….i would be judged as a chamar, not as a human being.

It is a depressing thought and I am not dealing with it correctly...but what is the point? I cannot undo any of this. Does it mean that I need to consider caste as the primary criteria to make friends? Should I ignore natural attraction or should I be attracted to only caste approved friends? How would 2 caste appropriate couple look like in college ? Do I even know a female who is SC/ST? Would she spurn me as she may not want to be seen as SC/ST? Or it would be a comic relief moment like in old movies where the comedy sidekick would have a comedy sidekick female as a mate? Am I a sidekick in my own story? Are all SC/ST burden on society? Is reservation a right earned or is it a nice offering by society’ nice ppl….the kind that white people felt when they encountered tribal/natives in their imperial conquests? Do I really have friends ? Would they react similarly?

I have lots of questions.

Maybe she left me because I suck….generally as a person….too tight lipped, no fun….and have no ability to afford fun. Gunjan gets Rs50 a day, and I get Rs 20 a week. She needs to live life at its fullest...maybe I was becoming a roadblock in this….my being generally negative and jealous of most guys she interacts….i know all of them are bastards….but hot girls do prioritize feeling of jealousy rather than analyzing the behavior in a cerebral way.

I have succeeded in inheriting a scooter from my father, but I do not want her to be seen on it….it is way below her standards...and I am not sure if I am the right choice for her….so better is to be alone….and stay away...self preserve….whatever is left….and maybe some day….. The thing I am absolutely sure of that she is better off without me….tainting her with chamar touch is the last thing I want to do. Gunjan, before formally telling me to stay away….also made clear that we were never in a relationship….i can only imagine how disappointing she must be feeling in me.

Maybe it never happened...maybe it is all in my head….and maybe this all is true. I try not to think of this.

I am starting to like cigarettes. They dont ask any questions, dont judge you, loyal to the core for the ones who are just checked out of life….blaming cigarettes and not the world or their inability to deal with it. 5 minutes of pure bliss….mind blanks out….numbness for 5 minutes….that is all I can afford right now. Not worried about cancer….it would be a blessing in disguise right now….a perfect alibi for my failures.

At college….i do get a breather. Friends do know about the breakup….they are sympathetic...and help me with studies. The only thing which I seem to have gained is Anusha and Ashish….both of them seem to have accepted me despite my chamar-ness.

Anusha is a popular girl in college. She talks to me mostly, happy and optimistic….somethings which do give me hope..that these circumstances are my and my burden alone...life can be fair and enjoyable.

It is not all bad, my account seems like a lot of self pity. There are some things which have my attention…... I got my computer – aVintron P3 with 16MB RAM, 4 GB of HDD. That poor thing is facing the brunt of my attention. It took some convincing with my father to make him shell out 45k for this latest computer. RAM was bit on low side, but I am making it work.

In college, we still use the age old Turbo C, an outdated IDE which works on DOS or windows. Most my my college mates still use it. For me it is too old. I had computers as an elective in my school, where I consistently topped my class without any efforts. I seem to have a knack for computers, so I decided to kick it up a notch….try the most exciting thing happening in computer science – LINUX.

CDs – which came along with computer magazine were the primary medium of getting latest software, or there was grey market for pirated software. I have become friends with some of competitors at local video game parlor. Taking up computers as major in college seems like a golden ticket to all Indian middle class, hence some of these friends had the luxury of computer magazine subs. They are kind enough to let me borrow them. This months CD was RED HAT linux 6.2, which no one could make sense out of. I have the complete ownership of it. So here I was….with an exam tomo, and computer with this thing called LINUX in front of me. Time flew – I did not give up even after rendering the computer unusable. There is no internet – only man pages to make sense out of this so called GUI installer. I soaked it all in...it made a whole lot of sense to me. I failed in that exam, but it felt like a good bargain. This has become a sole obsession for me now, whenever I font have money (almost everyday) I spend this time breaking my head with Linux and making sense of it. I am fascinated by the intellect of these people, their generosity, and their confidence of putting your work out there. I can endlessly write about Open Source and how it is the greatest feat achieved my mankind so far. It outweighs industrial revolution, bulbs, electricity by a long shot in my opinion. All those inventions were a result of greed, profit or just grandiose….this was something different….people working for a cause...with no incentive….trying to change the world with little hope and pure merit….and they were steady and unapologetic. And here I was, still fighting some obsolete human construct without any rhyme or logic. In a way, this philosophy appealed to me deeply, more than anything else in the world.

I am seeking people – teachers or students with similar outlook, but I am hoping for too much. College or the incompetent, Chamar loathing teachers which this college hired are the biggest reason of me giving up on academics.

My bitterness with this college has followed a linear graph. From a proud and optimistic student on day 1, when I was on top of the world, to this dismissive, pessimistic hollow creature...the decline has been phenomenal. This instance which happened in this semester broke my last belief of intellectual parity in this world.

In one of the tests we were given the following problem

Q: Write a function to find number vowels in a string. (5 Marks)

My solution was on the lines of something similar as below:

int count_vowels(char input[])

{

int num_vowels=0;

char character;

for (int i=0; i<strlen(input), i++)

{

//convert to lowercase

if ( input[i] >= A)

character = input[i] – 32;

else

character = input[i];

switch(character):

{

case ‘e’:

case ‘i’:

case ‘o’:

.

num_vowels++;

break;

}

return num_vowels;

}

I was sure of getting 30/30. Most of the my peers did get 30/30. I got 25/30. I went to our pretty teacher. I waited for the initial excitement to settle, then went to her with the answer book, with this solution open.

Mam, this is correct, but marked as wrong.

Why are you not using multiple breaks? And what is this weird if else thing in the loop.

This is to handle uppercase letters.

Ok, why is not every case statement followed by break?

Mam, it is a shortcut to optimize………………..

How many shortcuts in life would you take?

I was not sure what she meant...or I was not sure if it was intended in the way I perceived it. I looked up to make sure. She was slightly smiling, with undeniable hint of superiority ….the same which expression rich people have when they deny a request from a helpless being….dog or beggar.

I paused, then without saying a word, I went back to my desk. I was in denial for few days….coming to terms with a hard reality is difficult…..given I had wonderful teachers in my school. A core biological value of being treated fairly was in question. When the denial progressed to acceptance, my my transformation was complete.

I have taken this as a kind of challenge….I wont give a fuck and still pass...lets see how bad it can get?

And it has gotten really bad. Bad to the extent that despite being the best coder in this batch, I would never get the marks to reflect that. Like a typical bullheaded uncaring asshole that I am, I have no desire to raise this very prove-able discrimination, I would take whatever marks were granted with a smile. People were given perfect 100 in labs, and I would get 70,80 but never above that. These are the lowest marks awarded in these lab evaluations.

I am not budging. As my tenure in this college progresses, this typical Punjabi overconfident cunt of a teacher would not leave a single opportunity to deny me a fair evaluation and other teachers included lab assistants have joined in.

entry.content:
• No more Maths!!
  • I am in love with my dream girl Gunjan, and she seems to love me too
  • Got into a prestigious engineering college, that too on a free seat
  • Mom and Dad seem to be proud.
  • I have loyal friends who are fun and inspiring too
  • Sisters are happy in their own worlds

After six months of anxiety, Everything seems to be going my way. World is a fair place, life is fair.

Then why is my spidey sense tingling ? I should be happy, content and optimistic.....but the tingling is growing bigger, unavoidable , something that demands urgency.

As I am thinking, the pessimistic chamar boy inside me gets another opportunity to tell me to recall the lessons imparted by my father. The mini horror stories which my father seems to hide, or sometimes he would try to share a varnished version of his rough experiences being chamar boy senior.

His stories were often re-runs, though his narration and emotions would change each time he recounted his experiences.

I tried to listen, though my sisters seemed to phase them out. I think being older they have listened to these stories more than me, and now they know the story but cant seem to relate the message to current circumstances.

A father walks a difficult path, whether to fill his kids with optimism, or to warn them about how fucked up the real world is. How men turn into farm animals – just give them privacy and some leverage over the other person.

This is what i have gotten to know so far from my father and his choice of composition of his re run stories.

For last 2 years, things have been bitter in the house. Ever since my elder sister ran off to marry a brahmin boy, my father seems to have taken a rather pessimistic view of life. His sentences indicate dejection, sound impersonal and formal. It seemed like his faith in his kids has been lost. Every tone sounds defensive, as if he is trying to distance us from the decisions we may take. He became a very formal father. There may have an attempt to acknowledge me as an adult member of the house, which translated to more duties and expectations without any chance of failure.

There may have been some resentment from my side too....considering i have been physically and publicly beaten by my father on a few occasions. Last incident was just few months back.

I will finally get a computer!!! That is the gain i have focused my attention on. I have earned it.

Gunjan seems happy, we talk everyday at night...the telephone bills have been noticed, so i call her from a public phone-booth owner by a creepy guy. Rs 1 for 3 minutes of awkward silences, random talk. I do get probed for lost time and begging for more pocket-money is a weekly ritual....just to hear her voice.

Gunjan and I share a something spiritual... a level of emotional intimacy that is hard to describe. I know she is damaged, misunderstood, happy, having a very desirable female form which attracts all kinds of attention.

I have not told her about my feelings for her, and she makes extra efforts to make me feel like another extra in her life....she likes me, waits for my call, gives me attention, tries to keep tabs on me too...but the beauty of it all has been ....i always felt insecure...her words express indifference though her tone is always enticing....a riddle that i can never solve.

Elder sister visits, though her visits are very stressful.

Younger sister is not doing well though. I never identified with her...her values, her approach to problem analysis and solutions has been highly circumspect. Ever since my elder sister eloped, we look out for each other, though I do not understand her choices. She is my new support system. She is struggling with studies, personal relationships though she seems to be happy and optimistic.

My mother has become more viscous. She seems to be always on lookout for anything remotely suspicious. Our college timings, friends....everything was her area of attention and instant judgment.

Most nights, my father and mother would drink up senseless. Me and my sister were assigned the ground floor, mother and father used to occupy first floor. At ten, we would depart to our respective rooms. In my estimate, my father and mother consume 3-4 pegs of whiskey along with a beer each before losing the sense of loudness and awareness.

I could hear her inciting my father everyday on either of these few issues:

  • how their own daughter betrayed them
  • how their siblings have betrayed them
  • how my sister and i are following in our elder sisters footsteps.

Some nights, my mother would cover a few issues and on really bad ones, they would cover all, get drunker than usual and call despicable names for all .... including us.

My nights were simple - trying to call Gunjan at nights, be on guard if things go bad.

The really bad nights were the one where my mother would succeed in finding something which was remotely true....and my sister’s struggle in her life would give her periodic ammunition. Special night horror show used to start with our parents discussing about my sister or me, in an extremely loud, obnoxiously oblivious way...as if they deliberately want us to hear their messaging, giving them benefit of doubt of being drunk. After 25-40 minutes of this intentional yet unintentional drama, my father would call out for both of us. These edge of seat, awaiting the dreaded call-out moments kept me anxious to say the least. I have to keep listening, to be ready to defend us, if and when we would be called out to discuss issues in my chamaar family style.

My father has 2 very noticeable flaws

  1. He is and has been afraid of conflict.
  2. His judgment seems to be influence-able, proven by the fact that my illogical, viscous mom had succeeded in isolating him from the world he nurtured – our village where we were genuinely cared for. His own kids seem like a liability to him now

My uncles -father’s brothers have been the best tutors to nurture us as kids, we being the initial ones in our unusually big joint family. Our extended family was respected and feared at the same time. My granddad had a larger than life image – his tool was his aggression, flamboyance and the original devil may care attitude.

My father and uncles were an exact mirror opposite image of my grandfather. Logical, careful, painfully aware of their status in society’s pecking order. All of them made out of the same material as my grandmother – a genuine diplomat with extremely caring personality – perfectly complementary characteristics to my grandfather. My time spend in this environment has been the most happiest, blissful period of my life. This deserves a separate post later.

Coming back to spidey sense....it has been tingling ever since my elder sister has eloped, every night has been a torture, a reminder of how i need to run away from home as soon as i start earning. I have a whole plan – i would move to a different city, elope with Gunjan and live happily ever after and telling about my truth in the deathbed. She is everything i need!! and sometimes she helps me distance from my fucked up nights. Though I cannot afford love in current circumstances, I need her…she is the only normal thing in my teenage life, my only sense of intimacy of thought...a sense of belonging, loving.

It is 10, and horror show resumes : S03E234.

I have the luxury of space – I have taken the living room at ground floor as my room. The room is directly above our functional living room, where my mom and dad discuss their daily challenges and defeats. I can hear when they move their glasses or go to the balcony. I try to not be in this room when these drunken conversations are happening. Cannot call Gunjan right now, I might be called in anytime upstairs, then I would have to explain her about the abrupt phone hangup. Also her phone is rarely available from 10-11, I prefer to call her after my parents conclude their night party.

ChamarBoy, come upstairs….we need to discuss something.

The dreaded call has come. Why now, why today...my mind is racing. My sister is also called. I get out...i can see my sister standing in the hallway too. This time the issue seems to be about her academics...though my father thinks of these meetings as a bonus to teach me.

We try to get out of it, by making feeble excuses, but I am not sure if those were heard. We have become somewhat used to this routine. We are smiling outside with our minds racing.

The stairs are dark, sister (lets call her rani delusional) lits up the dreaded U shape stairway. We start walking. As we reach in the middle to take the U step, mom unbolts the 1st floor entry gate.

“Sab sach batana warna ghar se nikal denge tere papa….tumhe humari life mein problem create karne ke alawa aata hi kya hai……

..

…”

Mom’s background abuses are faded away as we enter the living room. The smell and the moment remind of your place in this house.

Shaadi karni hai ya padhai?

I looked up – It is not a question you may ask your 17 year son. I am not sure if he asked me or my sister?

He was looking at me.

5 seconds pass, it cant be that obvious ? Can it be?

“padhai”

“Toh padhta kyun nahin hai?”

“papa mein padh raha hoon”

“Tera admission kitni pareshani ke baad hua hai, bhagte bhoot ki langoti pakdi hai tune, kabhi pura kaam bhi kar liya kar”

He has a point there – I cant seem to get anything completed. I do the bare minimum and take my chances. Too much life is happening around me. Gunjan takes away most of my time and attention.

Papa, I am doing well now (I really am not)

After a couple of more awkward questions, we are signaled to leave. It is 12 now, new day has started.

Is Gunjan up??

I hurry to my room and hookup a stolen/borrowed landline phone into the telephone sockets which I have secretly extended to my room. This is a lineman’s phone – big yellow with rotary dial. One of my friends had gifted this phone to me – I think he stole it when lineman was up in the pole and left his work bag on ground. What a genuine buddy!!

It is ringing………..no response…...is she angry?? Is she done with me?? Has she found someone better ( everyone is better!!)??….maybe she wants me to feel disposable….she is a weird girl...i think she sabotages things..when they become real…

No response. I decide not to try again….she might be sleeping or she is ignoring me...either ways I cant seem to sleep.

Things with Gunjan have been complicated to say the least. A loser general boy who couldn't not even clear BBA exams told her that I belong to SC/ST category, hence I am able to clear the entrance exams. This is not a false statement...it was my truth to tell….i wanted to tell her when I was ready.

It devoids me of the privilege of telling my truth personally, and I would have told her when I was sure of my worthiness. Yes I have been lying to her….self preservation reasons mainly. A prom queen cannot be seen with a chamar boy….that much was clear to me.

I could see her slipping away...she has been acting aloof...even by her hot girl persona.

Love or even creating a possibility of love is an expensive proposition for anyone at my standards. Even I ignore the substantial emotional baggage and guilt I have been carrying….my world was built on a false identity….all of which may collapse once my truth is out.

And there are college studies too...12 exams in a curtailed 1st semester in 4 months including my demon - Mathematics!
